intro: Kyllinga uncinata, commonly known as the hooked kyllinga, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear tiny, three-lobed flowers. Kyllinga uncinata typically grows in wet or moist soils, often found in marshy areas or along waterways. It is sometimes cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
